Activity: Check emails and respond to any outstanding inquiries. Follow up with staff members who have not yet completed the needs assessment questionnaire.
Finalize the learning objectives and share them with @clinlead-1, @pchmp-1, @his-1, @his-2, @da-1 and @da-2 for their approval.
Document the entire needs assessment process, including the methodology, data analysis, and key findings. Create a comprehensive report for future reference.
Schedule a meeting with all relevant stakeholders to present the learning objectives and training outline. Gather final feedback and address any concerns.
Prepare a communication plan to inform staff members about the upcoming training program. Include details about the training objectives, schedule, and registration process.
Lunch break. Enjoy a relaxing meal and reflect on the week's accomplishments.
Send out the communication plan to all staff members involved in influenza data collection. Emphasize the importance of the training program for the success of the project.
Begin planning the next phase of the training program, which will focus on developing the training materials and scheduling the training sessions.
Organize all project-related documents and files. Ensure that everything is properly labeled and stored in a secure location.
Review the week's accomplishments and identify any outstanding tasks that need to be addressed next week. Prepare a to-do list for Monday.
